title: How to Logout From Mail on iPhone: Complete Guide

steps.title: Open your iPhone's Settings.
steps.content: Open your iPhone's Settings. It's the grey gear icon on the Home screen. [1] X Research source To log out of mail in the iPhone mail app, you will need to delete the account. If you only want to sign out temporarily, see the next section . Otherwise, you can add it again later.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Apps.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Apps . You will find it at the bottom of the menu. If you're on an older version of iOS, skip this step.

steps.title: Tap Mail.
steps.content: Tap Mail . You may need to scroll down to find this option.

steps.title: Tap Mail Accounts.
steps.content: Tap Mail Accounts . This is near the top of the page. You'll see a list of all email accounts you have added to your iPhone.

steps.title: Tap the account you want to log out from.
steps.content: Tap the account you want to log out from. A confirmation message will appear.

steps.title: Tap Delete Account.
steps.content: Tap Delete Account . Some versions of iOS may say Sign Out instead.

steps.title: Tap Delete Account again.
steps.content: Tap Delete Account again. This will sign you out of the Mail app on your iPhone and remove the email account's data, including any synced emails, contacts, and calendar events.

steps.title: Open your iPhone's Settings.
steps.content: Open your iPhone's Settings. It's the grey gear icon on the Home Screen. This method will turn off Mail syncing, which prevents you from receiving new messages until you turn it back on. Use this method if you only want to sign out of your email account temporarily.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Apps.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Apps . It's all the way at the bottom of the Settings menu. If you're on an older version of iOS, skip this step.

steps.title: Tap Mail.
steps.content: Tap Mail . You may need to scroll down to find this option.

steps.title: Tap Mail Accounts.
steps.content: Tap Mail Accounts . This is near the top of the page. You'll see a list of all mail accounts added to your iPhone.

steps.title: Tap the email account you want to turn off temporarily.
steps.content: Tap the email account you want to turn off temporarily. When you disable an account temporarily, you won't be able to send or receive email with that account on your iPhone. You can enable the account again at any time.

steps.title: Toggle off "Mail".
steps.content: Toggle off "Mail". If you're using an iCloud email account, you'll turn off Use on this iPhone instead. If you want to keep other features on for this account, such as Contacts, Calendars, and Reminders, keep their corresponding toggle switches in the on position.

steps.title: Open the Gmail app on your iPhone.
steps.content: Open the Gmail app on your iPhone. This looks like a multi-colored M icon. Use this method if you're logged into Gmail on the Gmail app and want to sign out. [2] X Research source Signing out of the Gmail app on your iPhone will not affect the Mail app.

steps.title: Tap your profile icon.
steps.content: Tap your profile icon. This is at the top-right corner of the app.

steps.title: Tap Manage accounts on this device.
steps.content: Tap Manage accounts on this device . This is at the very bottom of the screen. If you have a lot of accounts added, you may need to scroll down to see this option.

steps.title: Tap Remove from device under your account.
steps.content: Tap Remove from device under your account. This will delete the email from the Gmail app. If you want to remove the email account temporarily, tap the switch so it moves to the off (grey) position instead. When you're ready to enable it again, tap the switch so it moves to the on (blue) position.

steps.title: Open your iPhone's Settings.
steps.content: Open your iPhone's Settings. It's the grey gear icon on the Home Screen. If you logged out of Mail earlier, you can use this method to log back in.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Apps.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Apps . If you're on an older version of iOS, skip this step.

steps.title: Tap Mail.
steps.content: Tap Mail . You may need to scroll down to find this option.

steps.title: Tap Mail Accounts.
steps.content: Tap Mail Accounts . This is near the top of the page. You'll see a list of all mail accounts added to your iPhone.

steps.title: Tap Add Account.
steps.content: Tap Add Account . If you have existing emails linked to the Mail app, you'll see them listed under the Accounts header.

steps.title: Tap the email provider.
steps.content: Tap the email provider. You can select iCloud , Microsoft Exchange, Google , Yahoo , AOL, Outlook, or other.

steps.title: Log into your email account.
steps.content: Log into your email account. This will look different depending on the provider you selected. Follow the on-screen instructions to sign into your account. Once signed in, you can select the features you want to sync, such as Contacts, Calendars, Reminders, and Notes.

steps.title: Swipe to the App Library.
steps.content: Swipe to the App Library. This is on the far right when swiping from the home screen. Use this method if you accidentally deleted the Mail app from your home screen and want to add it back.

steps.title: Find the Mail app.
steps.content: Find the Mail app. You can search for the app icon in the folders, or type "mail" into the search bar at the top.

steps.title: Tap and hold the Mail app.
steps.content: Tap and hold the Mail app. A pop-up menu will open. If a menu doesn't open, tap and hold the app, and then drag it to your home screen.

steps.title: Tap Add to Home Screen.
steps.content: Tap Add to Home Screen . The Mail app will be added to your home screen. If desired, you can rearrange the apps on your home screen.
